mdRecord.dcterms:title: The Voice of Prince Edward County, Vol. ?, No. 4
mdRecord.dcterms:description: "Moon Success: Earthly Hunger" - Author Unknown - A column questioning the benefits of the space program when so much needs to be done in the United States to improve the lives of citizens. / "Church Closes Doors to Five Worshippers" - Author Unknown - Five men were denied entrance to the Farmville Baptist Church because one of them was black. / "Black Representatives Are Silent" - Author Unknown - The two black school board representatives are chastised / "Worthy Says School System Uncivilized" - Author Unknown - A white member of the school board says he will continue to send his children to the Academy until the public schools are run in a "civilized manner." / "Die: But for Something Valuable" - Author Unknown - A piece condemning Farmville Baptist Church for not allowing the Black community to attend their services.
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Various Contributors
Aphonso Vance White, editor
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: African American newspapers
Associations, institutions, etc.—African American membership
Race discrimination—United States
Prince Edward County (Va.)
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: The Voice of Prince Edward County
